name: 1607_A. Linear Keyboard
description:
You are given a keyboard that consists of 26 keys. The keys are arranged sequentially in one row in a certain order. Each key corresponds to a unique lowercase Latin letter.

You have to type the word s on this keyboard. It also consists only of lowercase Latin letters.

To type a word, you need to type all its letters consecutively one by one. To type each letter you must position your hand exactly over the corresponding key and press it.

Moving the hand between the keys takes time which is equal to the absolute value of the difference between positions of these keys (the keys are numbered from left to right). No time is spent on pressing the keys and on placing your hand over the first letter of the word.

For example, consider a keyboard where the letters from 'a' to 'z' are arranged in consecutive alphabetical order. The letters 'h', 'e', 'l' and 'o' then are on the positions 8, 5, 12 and 15, respectively. Therefore, it will take |5 - 8| + |12 - 5| + |12 - 12| + |15 - 12| = 13 units of time to type the word "hello". 

Determine how long it will take to print the word s.

Input

The first line contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

The next 2t lines contain descriptions of the test cases.

The first line of a description contains a keyboard — a string of length 26, which consists only of lowercase Latin letters. Each of the letters from 'a' to 'z' appears exactly once on the keyboard.

The second line of the description contains the word s. The word has a length from 1 to 50 letters inclusive and consists of lowercase Latin letters.

Output

Print t lines, each line containing the answer to the corresponding test case. The answer to the test case is the minimal time it takes to type the word s on the given keyboard.

Example

Input


5
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
hello
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
i
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
codeforces
qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm
qqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqq
qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm
abacaba


Output


13
0
68
0
74

prompt:
You have a keyboard with 26 keys arranged in sequence in one row in a specific order, where each key matches a distinct lowercase Latin letter, and you need to input the word s using this keyboard, which comprises only lowercase Latin letters.

To input a word, you must type all of its characters consecutively one by one; thus, to type each character, you must position your hand directly over the matching key and hit it.

Moving the hand between the keys takes time which is equal to the absolute value of the difference between positions of these keys (the keys are numbered from left to right), and no time is spent on pressing the keys and on placing your hand over the first letter of the word.

For instance, consider a keyboard where the letters from 'a' to 'z' are arranged in consecutive alphabetical order. The letters 'h', 'e', 'l' and 'o' then are on the positions 8, 5, 12 and 15, respectively, so it will take |5 - 8| + |12 - 5| + |12 - 12| + |15 - 12| = 13 units of time to type the word "hello".

Calculate how much time it will take to type the word s.

Input

The first line contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

The next 2t lines contain descriptions of the test cases.

The first line of a description contains a keyboard — a string of length 26, which consists only of lowercase Latin letters. Each of the letters from 'a' to 'z' appears exactly once on the keyboard.

The second line of the description contains the word s. The word has a length from 1 to 50 letters inclusive and consists of lowercase Latin letters.

Output

Print t lines, each line containing the answer to the corresponding test case. The answer to the test case is the minimal time it takes to type the word s on the given keyboard.

Example

Input


5
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
hello
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
i
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
codeforces
qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm
qqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqq
qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm
abacaba


Output


13
0
68
0
74
repair_prompt:
You have a keyboard with 26 keys arranged in sequence in one row in a specific order, where each key matches a distinct lowercase Latin letter, and you need to input the word s using this keyboard, which comprises only lowercase Latin letters.

To input a word, you must type all of its characters consecutively one by one; thus, to type each character, you must position your hand directly over the matching key and hit it.

Moving the hand between the keys takes time which is equal to the absolute value of the difference between positions of these keys (the keys are numbered from left to right), and no time is spent on pressing the keys and on placing your hand over the first letter of the word.

For instance, consider a keyboard where the letters from 'a' to 'z' are arranged in consecutive alphabetical order. The letters 'h', 'e', 'l' and 'o' then are on the positions 8, 5, 12 and 15, respectively, so it will take |5 - 8| + |12 - 5| + |12 - 12| + |15 - 12| = 13 units of time to type the word "hello".

Calculate how much time it will take to type the word s.

Input

The first line contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

The next 2t lines contain descriptions of the test cases.

The first line of a description contains a keyboard — a string of length 26, which consists only of lowercase Latin letters. Each of the letters from 'a' to 'z' appears exactly once on the keyboard.

The second line of the description contains the word s. The word has a length from 1 to 50 letters inclusive and consists of lowercase Latin letters.

Output

Print t lines, each line containing the answer to the corresponding test case. The answer to the test case is the minimal time it takes to type the word s on the given keyboard.

-------
Important Note: You must follow the input output format. Input must be taken from standard input and output must be given to standard output. The code will be tested against multiple test cases and all the test cases must be passed.
Example

Input


5
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
hello
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
i
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
codeforces
qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm
qqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqq
qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm

0

Write a main() function and use input() function to read input from stdin

from typing import List
## main.py

def calculate_typing_time(keyboard: str, word: str) -> int:
    # Create a dictionary to map each character to its position on the keyboard
    keyboard_positions = {}
    for index, char in enumerate(keyboard):
        keyboard_positions[char] = index
    
    # Initialize the total typing time
    total_time = 0
    
    # Calculate the typing time for each character in the word
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        current_char = word[i]
        previous_char = word[i - 1]
        current_pos = keyboard_positions[current_char]
        previous_pos = keyboard_positions[previous_char]
        # Add the absolute difference in positions to the total time
        total_time += abs(current_pos - previous_pos)
    
    return total_time

# Read the number of test cases
t = int(input())

# Process each test case
for _ in range(t):
    # Read the keyboard layout and the word to type
    keyboard = input().strip()
    word = input().strip()
    
    # Calculate and print the typing time for the word
    result = calculate_typing_time(keyboard, word)
    print(result)
from typing import List
## main.py

def calculate_typing_time(keyboard: str, word: str) -> int:
    """
    Calculate the time required to type a given word on a specific keyboard layout.

    Args:
        keyboard (str): A string representing the keyboard layout where each character is a unique lowercase Latin letter.
        word (str): The word to be typed, consisting of lowercase Latin letters.

    Returns:
        int: The total time required to type the word.
    """
    # Create a dictionary to map each letter to its position on the keyboard
    keyboard_positions = {char: index for index, char in enumerate(keyboard)}

    # Initialize the total time to 0
    total_time = 0

    # Iterate through the word to calculate the typing time
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        # Get the positions of the current and previous characters
        current_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i]]
        previous_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i - 1]]

        # Calculate the time to move from the previous character to the current character
        time_to_move = abs(current_pos - previous_pos)

        # Add the time to the total time
        total_time += time_to_move

    return total_time

# Read the number of test cases
t = int(input())

# Process each test case
for _ in range(t):
    # Read the keyboard layout and the word
    keyboard = input().strip()
    word = input().strip()

    # Calculate and print the typing time for the word
    result = calculate_typing_time(keyboard, word)
    print(result)
from typing import List
## main.py

def calculate_typing_time(keyboard: str, word: str) -> int:
    """
    Calculate the time required to type a given word based on a provided keyboard layout.

    Args:
        keyboard (str): A string representing the keyboard layout where each character is a unique lowercase Latin letter.
        word (str): The word to be typed, consisting of lowercase Latin letters.

    Returns:
        int: The total time required to type the word.
    """
    keyboard_positions = {char: idx for idx, char in enumerate(keyboard)}
    total_time = 0
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        prev_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i - 1]]
        curr_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i]]
        total_time += abs(prev_pos - curr_pos)
    return total_time

# Read the number of test cases from a parameter
t = int(input())

# Process each test case
for _ in range(t):
    # Read the keyboard layout and the word to type from parameters
    keyboard = input().strip()
    word = input().strip()

    # Calculate and print the typing time for the word
    result = calculate_typing_time(keyboard, word)
    print(result)

        word (str): The word to be typed, consisting of lowercase Latin letters.

    Returns:
        int: The total time required to type the word.
    """
    # Create a dictionary to map each character to its position on the keyboard
    keyboard_positions = {char: idx for idx, char in enumerate(keyboard)}

    # Initialize the total time to 0
    total_time = 0

    # Calculate the time for each character in the word
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        current_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i]]
        prev_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i - 1]]
        total_time += abs(current_pos - prev_pos)

    return total_time

import sys

def calculate_typing_time(keyboard: str, word: str) -> int:
    """
    Calculate the time it takes to type a word based on a given keyboard layout.

    Args:
        keyboard (str): A string representing the keyboard layout where each character is a unique lowercase Latin letter.
        word (str): The word to be typed, consisting of lowercase Latin letters.

    Returns:
        int: The total time required to type the word.
    """
    # Create a dictionary to map each character to its position on the keyboard
    keyboard_positions = {char: idx for idx, char in enumerate(keyboard)}

    # Initialize the total time to 0
    total_time = 0

    # Iterate through the word to calculate the typing time
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        # Get the positions of the current and previous characters
        current_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i]]
        previous_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i - 1]]

        # Calculate the time to move from the previous character to the current character
        time_to_move = abs(current_pos - previous_pos)

        # Add the time to the total time
        total_time += time_to_move

    return total_time

from typing import List
## main.py

def calculate_typing_time(keyboard: str, word: str) -> int:
    """
    Calculate the total time taken to type a word based on the positions of letters on a keyboard.

    Args:
        keyboard (str): A string representing the layout of the keyboard where each character is a unique lowercase Latin letter.
        word (str): The word to be typed, consisting of lowercase Latin letters.

    Returns:
        int: The total time taken to type the word.
    """
    # Create a dictionary to map each character to its position on the keyboard
    keyboard_positions = {char: idx for idx, char in enumerate(keyboard)}

    # Initialize the total time to 0
    total_time = 0

    # Iterate through the word to calculate the time for each character
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        # Get the positions of the current and previous characters
        current_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i]]
        previous_pos = keyboard_positions[word[i - 1]]

        # Calculate the time taken to move from the previous character to the current character
        time_taken = abs(current_pos - previous_pos)

        # Add the time taken to the total time
        total_time += time_taken

    return total_time

# Read the number of test cases
t = int(input())

# Process each test case
for _ in range(t):
    # Read the keyboard layout and the word
    keyboard = input().strip()
    word = input().strip()

    # Calculate and print the typing time for the word
    result = calculate_typing_time(keyboard, word)
    print(result)
from typing import List
## main.py

def calculate_typing_time(keyboard: str, word: str) -> int:
    """
    Calculate the time it takes to type a word based on the position of each character on a keyboard.

    Args:
        keyboard (str): A string representing the layout of the keyboard.
        word (str): The word to be typed.

    Returns:
        int: The total time required to type the word.
    """
    # Create a dictionary to store the position of each character on the keyboard
    key_positions = {}
    for index, key in enumerate(keyboard):
        key_positions[key] = index

    # Initialize the total time to 0
    total_time = 0

    # Calculate the time to type each character in the word
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        current_key = word[i]
        previous_key = word[i - 1]
        current_pos = key_positions[current_key]
        previous_pos = key_positions[previous_key]
        total_time += abs(current_pos - previous_pos)

    return total_time

# Read the number of test cases
t = int(input())

# Process each test case
for _ in range(t):
    keyboard = input()
    word = input()
    result = calculate_typing_time(keyboard, word)
    print(result)

## main.py

def calculate_typing_time(keyboard: str, word: str) -> int:
    """
    Calculate the time required to type a word based on the positions of the letters on a keyboard.

    Args:
        keyboard (str): A string representing the layout of the keyboard where each character is a unique lowercase Latin letter.
        word (str): The word to be typed.

    Returns:
        int: The total time required to type the word.
    """
    # Create a dictionary to map each character to its position on the keyboard
    keyboard_positions = {}
    for index, char in enumerate(keyboard):
        keyboard_positions[char] = index

    # Initialize the total time to 0
    total_time = 0

    # Calculate the time for each character in the word
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        current_char = word[i]
        previous_char = word[i - 1]
        current_pos = keyboard_positions[current_char]
        previous_pos = keyboard_positions[previous_char]
        total_time += abs(current_pos - previous_pos)

    return total_time

# Read the number of test cases

from typing import List
## main.py

def calculate_typing_time(keyboard: str, word: str) -> int:
    # Create a dictionary to map each character to its position on the keyboard
    keyboard_positions = {}
    for index, char in enumerate(keyboard):
        keyboard_positions[char] = index
    
    # Initialize the typing time to 0
    typing_time = 0
    
    # Iterate through each character in the word
    for i in range(1, len(word)):
        # Calculate the time to type the current character
        current_char = word[i]
        previous_char = word[i - 1]
        time_to_type_current = abs(keyboard_positions[current_char] - keyboard_positions[previous_char])
        
        # Add the time to the total typing time
        typing_time += time_to_type_current
    
    return typing_time

# Read the number of test cases
t = int(input())

# Process each test case
for _ in range(t):
    # Read the keyboard layout and the word to type
    keyboard = input().strip()
    word = input().strip()
    
    # Calculate the typing time for the word
    result = calculate_typing_time(keyboard, word)
    
    # Output the total typing time for the word
    print(result)

The function will first map each character to its position on the keyboard, then calculate the time based on the absolute difference between the positions of consecutive characters.
examples:
Input

The first line contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 1000) — the number of test cases.

The next 2t lines contain descriptions of the test cases.

The first line of a description contains a keyboard — a string of length 26, which consists only of lowercase Latin letters. Each of the letters from 'a' to 'z' appears exactly once on the keyboard.

The second line of the description contains the word s. The word has a length from 1 to 50 letters inclusive and consists of lowercase Latin letters.

Output

Print t lines, each line containing the answer to the corresponding test case. The answer to the test case is the minimal time it takes to type the word s on the given keyboard.

Example

Input


5
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
hello
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
i
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
codeforces
qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm
qqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqqq
qwertyuiopasdfghjklzxcvbnm
abacaba


Output


13
0
68
0
74
